<br>
<p dir="auto"><strong>WebTorrent</strong> is a streaming torrent client for <strong>node.js</strong> and the <strong>browser</strong>. YEP,
THAT'S RIGHT. THE BROWSER. It's written completely in JavaScript – the language of the web
– so the same code works in both runtimes.</p>
<p dir="auto">In node.js, this module is a simple torrent client, using TCP and UDP to talk to
other torrent clients.</p>
<p dir="auto">In the browser, WebTorrent uses <strong>WebRTC</strong> (data channels) for peer-to-peer transport.
It can be used <strong>without</strong> browser plugins, extensions, or installations. It's Just
JavaScript™. Note: WebTorrent does <strong>not</strong> support UDP/TCP peers in browser.</p>
<p dir="auto">Simply include the
<a href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/webtorrent@latest/webtorrent.min.js" rel="nofollow"><code>webtorrent.min.js</code></a> script
on your page to start fetching files over WebRTC using the BitTorrent protocol, or
<code>import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent'</code> with <a href="http://browserify.org/" rel="nofollow">browserify</a> or <a href="https://webpack.js.org/" rel="nofollow">webpack</a>. See <a href="#who-is-using-webtorrent-today">demo apps
</a> and <a href="#usage">code examples</a> below.</p>
<p dir="auto"><a href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/webtorrent@latest/webtorrent.min.js" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/e047deb0f1df8a1adb7246bd67415a466e91e8403e2f6e59b58471ce61d4e1fc/68747470733a2f2f646174612e6a7364656c6976722e636f6d2f76312f7061636b6167652f6e706d2f776562746f7272656e742f6261646765" alt="jsdelivr download count" data-canonical-src="https://data.jsdelivr.com/v1/package/npm/webtorrent/badge" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<p dir="auto">To make BitTorrent work over WebRTC (which is the only P2P transport that works on the
web) we made some protocol changes. Therefore, a browser-based WebTorrent client or <strong>"web
peer"</strong> can only connect to other clients that support WebTorrent/WebRTC.</p>
<p dir="auto">To seed files to web peers, use a client that supports WebTorrent, e.g.
<a href="https://webtorrent.io/desktop" rel="nofollow">WebTorrent Desktop</a>, a desktop client with a
familiar UI that can connect to web peers,
<a href="https://github.com/webtorrent/webtorrent-hybrid">webtorrent-hybrid</a>, a command line program,
or <a href="https://instant.io/" rel="nofollow">Instant.io</a>, a website. Established torrent clients like
<strong>Vuze</strong> have <a href="https://wiki.vuze.com/w/WebTorrent" rel="nofollow">already added WebTorrent support</a> so
they can connect to both normal <em>and</em> web peers. We hope other clients will follow.</p>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/21fe77acadaba6f57b12d0d89551b07c9253e06589f16dd9554c0de6547379b1/68747470733a2f2f776562746f7272656e742e696f2f696d672f6e6574776f726b2e706e67"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/21fe77acadaba6f57b12d0d89551b07c9253e06589f16dd9554c0de6547379b1/68747470733a2f2f776562746f7272656e742e696f2f696d672f6e6574776f726b2e706e67" alt="Network" data-canonical-src="https://webtorrent.io/img/network.png" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>
<h3 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-features" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#features"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Features</h3>
<ul dir="auto">
<li><strong>Torrent client for node.js & the browser</strong> (same npm package!)</li>
<li><strong>Insanely fast</strong></li>
<li>Download <strong>multiple torrents</strong> simultaneously, efficiently</li>
<li><strong>Pure Javascript</strong> (no native dependencies)</li>
<li>Exposes files as <strong>streams</strong>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Fetches pieces from the network on-demand so seeking is supported (even before torrent is finished)</li>
<li>Seamlessly switches between sequential and rarest-first piece selection strategy</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Supports advanced torrent client features
<ul dir="auto">
<li><strong>magnet uri</strong> support via <strong><a href="https://github.com/webtorrent/ut_metadata">ut_metadata</a></strong></li>
<li><strong>peer discovery</strong> via <strong><a href="https://github.com/webtorrent/bittorrent-dht">dht</a></strong>,
<strong><a href="https://github.com/webtorrent/bittorrent-tracker">tracker</a></strong>,
<strong><a href="https://github.com/webtorrent/bittorrent-lsd">lsd</a></strong>, and
<strong><a href="https://github.com/webtorrent/ut_pex">ut_pex</a></strong></li>
<li><strong><a href="https://github.com/webtorrent/bittorrent-protocol#extension-api">protocol extension api</a></strong>
for adding new extensions</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>Comprehensive test suite</strong> (runs completely offline, so it's reliable and fast)</li>
<li>Check all the <strong><a href="/webtorrent/webtorrent/blob/master/docs/bep_support.md">supported BEPs here</a></strong></li>
</ul>
<h4 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-browserwebrtc-environment-features" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#browserwebrtc-environment-features"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Browser/WebRTC environment features</h4>
<ul dir="auto">
<li><strong>WebRTC data channels</strong> for lightweight peer-to-peer communication with <strong>no plugins</strong></li>
<li><strong>No silos.</strong> WebTorrent is a P2P network for the <strong>entire web.</strong> WebTorrent clients
running on one domain can connect to clients on any other domain.</li>
<li>Stream video torrents into a <code><video></code> tag (<code>webm, mkv, mp4, ogv, mov, etc (AV1, H264, HEVC*, VP8, VP9, AAC, FLAC, MP3, OPUS, Vorbis, etc)</code>)</li>
<li>Supports Chrome, Firefox, Opera and Safari.</li>
</ul>

<h3 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-install" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#install"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Install</h3>
<p dir="auto">To install WebTorrent for use in node or the browser with <code>import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent'</code>, run:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="npm install webtorrent"><pre>npm install webtorrent</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">To install a <code>webtorrent</code>
<a href="https://github.com/webtorrent/webtorrent-cli">command line program</a>, run:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="npm install webtorrent-cli -g"><pre>npm install webtorrent-cli -g</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">To install a WebTorrent desktop application for Mac, Windows, or Linux, see
<a href="https://webtorrent.io/desktop" rel="nofollow">WebTorrent Desktop</a>.</p>

<h3 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-usage" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#usage"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Usage</h3>
<p dir="auto">WebTorrent is the first BitTorrent client that works in the browser, using open web
standards (no plugins, just HTML5 and WebRTC)! It's easy to get started!</p>
<h4 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-in-the-browser" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#in-the-browser"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>In the browser</h4>
<h5 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-downloading-a-file-is-simple" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#downloading-a-file-is-simple"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Downloading a file is simple:</h5>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent'

const client = new WebTorrent()
const magnetURI = '...'

client.add(magnetURI, torrent => {
  // Got torrent metadata!
  console.log('Client is downloading:', torrent.infoHash)

  for (const file of torrent.files) {
    document.body.append(file.name)
  }
})"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">WebTorrent</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">'webtorrent'</span>

<span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">client</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-k">new</span> <span class="pl-v">WebTorrent</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">magnetURI</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s">'...'</span>

<span class="pl-s1">client</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">add</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">magnetURI</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">torrent</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
  <span class="pl-c">// Got torrent metadata!</span>
  <span class="pl-smi">console</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">log</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'Client is downloading:'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">torrent</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">infoHash</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>

  <span class="pl-k">for</span> <span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">file</span> <span class="pl-k">of</span> <span class="pl-s1">torrent</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">files</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
    <span class="pl-smi">document</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">body</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">append</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">file</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">name</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-kos">}</span>
<span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<h5 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-seeding-a-file-is-simple-too" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#seeding-a-file-is-simple-too"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Seeding a file is simple, too:</h5>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import dragDrop from 'drag-drop'
import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent'

const client = new WebTorrent()

// When user drops files on the browser, create a new torrent and start seeding it!
dragDrop('body', files => {
  client.seed(files, torrent => {
    console.log('Client is seeding:', torrent.infoHash)
  })
})"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">dragDrop</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">'drag-drop'</span>
<span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">WebTorrent</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">'webtorrent'</span>

<span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">client</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-k">new</span> <span class="pl-v">WebTorrent</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>

<span class="pl-c">// When user drops files on the browser, create a new torrent and start seeding it!</span>
<span class="pl-en">dragDrop</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'body'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">files</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
  <span class="pl-s1">client</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">seed</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">files</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">torrent</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>
    <span class="pl-smi">console</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">log</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'Client is seeding:'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">torrent</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">infoHash</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
  <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>
<span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">There are more examples in <a href="/webtorrent/webtorrent/blob/master/docs/get-started.md">docs/get-started.md</a>.</p>
<h5 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-browserify" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#browserify"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Browserify</h5>
<p dir="auto">WebTorrent works great with <a href="http://browserify.org/" rel="nofollow">browserify</a>, an npm package that lets
you use <a href="http://nodejs.org/" rel="nofollow">node</a>-style require() to organize your browser code and load modules installed by <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/" rel="nofollow">npm</a> (as seen in the previous examples).</p>
<h5 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-webpack" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#webpack"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Webpack</h5>
<p dir="auto">WebTorrent also works with <a href="https://webpack.js.org/" rel="nofollow">webpack</a>, another module
bundler. However, webpack requires extra configuration which you can find in <a href="/webtorrent/webtorrent/blob/master/scripts/browser.webpack.js">the webpack bundle config used by webtorrent</a>.</p>
<p dir="auto">Or, you can just use the pre-built version via
<code>import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent/dist/webtorrent.min.js'</code> and skip the webpack configuration.</p>
<h5 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-script-tag" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#script-tag"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Script tag</h5>
<p dir="auto">WebTorrent is also available as a standalone script
(<a href="/webtorrent/webtorrent/blob/master/webtorrent.min.js"><code>webtorrent.min.js</code></a>) which exposes <code>WebTorrent</code> on the <code>window</code>
object, so it can be used with just a script tag:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-text-html-basic notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="<script type='module'>
  import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent.min.js'
</script>"><pre><span class="pl-kos"><</span><span class="pl-ent">script</span> <span class="pl-c1">type</span>='<span class="pl-s">module</span>'<span class="pl-kos">></span>
  <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">WebTorrent</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">'webtorrent.min.js'</span>
<span class="pl-kos"></</span><span class="pl-ent">script</span><span class="pl-kos">></span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">The WebTorrent script is also hosted on fast, reliable CDN infrastructure (Cloudflare and
MaxCDN) for easy inclusion on your site:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-text-html-basic notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="<script type='module'>
  import WebTorrent from 'https://esm.sh/webtorrent'
</script>"><pre><span class="pl-kos"><</span><span class="pl-ent">script</span> <span class="pl-c1">type</span>='<span class="pl-s">module</span>'<span class="pl-kos">></span>
  <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">WebTorrent</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">'https://esm.sh/webtorrent'</span>
<span class="pl-kos"></</span><span class="pl-ent">script</span><span class="pl-kos">></span></pre></div>
<h5 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-chrome-app" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#chrome-app"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Chrome App</h5>
<p dir="auto">If you want to use WebTorrent in a
<a href="https://developer.chrome.com/apps/about_apps" rel="nofollow">Chrome App</a>, you can include the
following script:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-text-html-basic notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="<script type='module'>
  import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent.chromeapp.js'
</script>"><pre><span class="pl-kos"><</span><span class="pl-ent">script</span> <span class="pl-c1">type</span>='<span class="pl-s">module</span>'<span class="pl-kos">></span>
  <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">WebTorrent</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">'webtorrent.chromeapp.js'</span>
<span class="pl-kos"></</span><span class="pl-ent">script</span><span class="pl-kos">></span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Be sure to enable the <code>chrome.sockets.udp</code> and <code>chrome.sockets.tcp</code> permissions!</p>
<h4 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-in-nodejs" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#in-nodejs"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>In Node.js</h4>
<p dir="auto">WebTorrent also works in node.js, using the <em>same npm package!</em> It's mad science!</p>
<p dir="auto"><strong>NOTE</strong>: To connect to "web peers" (browsers) in addition to normal BitTorrent peers, use
<a href="https://github.com/webtorrent/webtorrent-hybrid">webtorrent-hybrid</a> which includes WebRTC
support for node.</p>
<h4 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-as-a-command-line-app" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#as-a-command-line-app"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>As a command line app</h4>
<p dir="auto">WebTorrent is also available as a
<a href="https://github.com/webtorrent/webtorrent-cli">command line app</a>. Here's how to use it:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ npm install webtorrent-cli -g
$ webtorrent --help"><pre>$ npm install webtorrent-cli -g
$ webtorrent --help</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">To download a torrent:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ webtorrent magnet_uri"><pre>$ webtorrent magnet_uri</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">To stream a torrent to a device like <strong>AirPlay</strong> or <strong>Chromecast</strong>, just pass a flag:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ webtorrent magnet_uri --airplay"><pre>$ webtorrent magnet_uri --airplay</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">There are many supported streaming options:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="--airplay               Apple TV
--chromecast            Chromecast
--mplayer               MPlayer
--mpv                   MPV
--omx [jack]            omx [default: hdmi]
--vlc                   VLC
--xbmc                  XBMC
--stdout                standard out [implies --quiet]"><pre>--airplay               Apple TV
--chromecast            Chromecast
--mplayer               MPlayer
--mpv                   MPV
--omx [jack]            omx [default: hdmi]
--vlc                   VLC
--xbmc                  XBMC
--stdout                standard out [implies --quiet]</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">In addition to magnet uris, WebTorrent supports <a href="/webtorrent/webtorrent/blob/master/docs/api.md#clientaddtorrentid-opts-function-ontorrent-torrent-">many ways</a> to specify a torrent.</p>
<h3 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-talks-about-webtorrent" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#talks-about-webtorrent"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Talks about WebTorrent</h3>
<ul dir="auto">
<li>Sep 2017 - Nordic JS - <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8N_4Furztjo" rel="nofollow">Get Rich Quick With P2P Crypto Currency</a></li>
<li>May 2017 - Char.la - <a href="https://youtu.be/D-04vg5hvEQ?t=54m20s" rel="nofollow">WebTorrent and Peerify</a> (Spanish)</li>
<li>Nov 2016 - NodeConf Argentina - <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YLExGgEnbFY" rel="nofollow">Real world Electron: Building Cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript</a></li>
<li>May 2016 - SIGNAL Conference - <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2qrUx-C5Np4" rel="nofollow">BitTorrent in the Browser</a></li>
<li>May 2015 - Data Terra Nemo - <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RRtNEcAaUO8" rel="nofollow">WebTorrent: Mother of all demos</a></li>
<li>May 2015 - Data Terra Nemo - <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RRtNEcAaUO8" rel="nofollow">WebRTC Everywhere</a></li>
<li>Nov 2014 - JSConf Asia - <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kxHRATfvnlw" rel="nofollow">How WebTorrent Works</a></li>
<li>Sep 2014 - NodeConf EU - <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BVBXkzVjvPc" rel="nofollow">WebRTC Mad Science</a> (first working WebTorrent demo)</li>
<li>Apr 2014 - CraftConf - <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PT8s_IVWDgw" rel="nofollow">Bringing BitTorrent to the Web</a></li>
<li>May 2014 - JS.LA - <a href="https://vimeo.com/97324247" rel="nofollow">How I Built a BitTorrent Client in the Browser</a> (progress update; node client working)</li>
<li>Oct 2013 - RealtimeConf - <a href="https://vimeo.com/77265280" rel="nofollow">WebRTC Black Magic</a> (first mention of idea for WebTorrent)</li>

<h3 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-modules" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#modules"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Modules</h3>
<p dir="auto">Most of the active development is happening inside of small npm packages which are used by WebTorrent.</p>
<h4 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-the-node-way" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#the-node-way"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>The Node Way™</h4>
<blockquote>
<p dir="auto">"When applications are done well, they are just the really application-specific, brackish residue that can't be so easily abstracted away. All the nice, reusable components sublimate away onto github and npm where everybody can collaborate to advance the commons." — substack from <a href="https://gist.github.com/substack/5075355">"how I write modules"</a></p>
</blockquote>
<p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/328e6333f6a787e999a9ad7483ce5f9a9100b7ade4df13d125d4ce18f7a295e1/68747470733a2f2f6665726f73732e6e65742f782f6e6f6465322e676966"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/328e6333f6a787e999a9ad7483ce5f9a9100b7ade4df13d125d4ce18f7a295e1/68747470733a2f2f6665726f73732e6e65742f782f6e6f6465322e676966" alt="node.js is shiny" data-animated-image="" data-canonical-src="https://feross.net/x/node2.gif" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p>

<h4 tabindex="-1" dir="auto"><a id="user-content-enable-debug-logs" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#enable-debug-logs"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Enable debug logs</h4>
<p dir="auto">In <strong>node</strong>, enable debug logs by setting the <code>DEBUG</code> environment variable to the name of the
module you want to debug (e.g. <code>bittorrent-protocol</code>, or <code>*</code> to print <strong>all logs</strong>).</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="DEBUG=* webtorrent"><pre>DEBUG=<span class="pl-k">*</span> webtorrent</pre></div>
<p dir="auto">In the <strong>browser</strong>, enable debug logs by running this in the developer console:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="localStorage.setItem('debug', '*')"><pre><span class="pl-s1">localStorage</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">setItem</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'debug'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'*'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>
<p dir="auto">Disable by running this:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="localStorage.removeItem('debug')"><pre><span class="pl-s1">localStorage</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">removeItem</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'debug'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div>

readabilityObject.title: GitHub - webtorrent/webtorrent: ⚡️ Streaming torrent client for the web
readabilityObject.content:
WebTorrent

The streaming torrent client. For node.js and the web.

Sponsored by            

WebTorrent is a streaming torrent client for node.js and the browser. YEP, THAT'S RIGHT. THE BROWSER. It's written completely in JavaScript – the language of the web – so the same code works in both runtimes.

In node.js, this module is a simple torrent client, using TCP and UDP to talk to other torrent clients.

In the browser, WebTorrent uses WebRTC (data channels) for peer-to-peer transport. It can be used without browser plugins, extensions, or installations. It's Just JavaScript™. Note: WebTorrent does not support UDP/TCP peers in browser.

Simply include the webtorrent.min.js script on your page to start fetching files over WebRTC using the BitTorrent protocol, or import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent' with browserify or webpack. See demo apps and code examples below.

To make BitTorrent work over WebRTC (which is the only P2P transport that works on the web) we made some protocol changes. Therefore, a browser-based WebTorrent client or "web peer" can only connect to other clients that support WebTorrent/WebRTC.

To seed files to web peers, use a client that supports WebTorrent, e.g. WebTorrent Desktop, a desktop client with a familiar UI that can connect to web peers, webtorrent-hybrid, a command line program, or Instant.io, a website. Established torrent clients like Vuze have already added WebTorrent support so they can connect to both normal and web peers. We hope other clients will follow.

Features

  • Torrent client for node.js & the browser (same npm package!)
  • Insanely fast
  • Download multiple torrents simultaneously, efficiently
  • Pure Javascript (no native dependencies)
  • Exposes files as streams
    • Fetches pieces from the network on-demand so seeking is supported (even before torrent is finished)
    • Seamlessly switches between sequential and rarest-first piece selection strategy
  • Supports advanced torrent client features
    • magnet uri support via ut_metadata
    • peer discovery via dht, tracker, lsd, and ut_pex
    • protocol extension api for adding new extensions
  • Comprehensive test suite (runs completely offline, so it's reliable and fast)
  • Check all the supported BEPs here

Browser/WebRTC environment features

  • WebRTC data channels for lightweight peer-to-peer communication with no plugins
  • No silos. WebTorrent is a P2P network for the entire web. WebTorrent clients running on one domain can connect to clients on any other domain.
  • Stream video torrents into a <video> tag (webm, mkv, mp4, ogv, mov, etc (AV1, H264, HEVC*, VP8, VP9, AAC, FLAC, MP3, OPUS, Vorbis, etc))
  • Supports Chrome, Firefox, Opera and Safari.

Install

To install WebTorrent for use in node or the browser with import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent', run:

To install a webtorrent command line program, run:

npm install webtorrent-cli -g

To install a WebTorrent desktop application for Mac, Windows, or Linux, see WebTorrent Desktop.

Ways to help

  • Join us in Gitter or on freenode at #webtorrent to help with development or to hang out with some mad science hackers :)
  • Create a new issue to report bugs
  • Fix an issue. WebTorrent is an OPEN Open Source Project!

Who is using WebTorrent today?

Lots of folks!

WebTorrent API Documentation

Read the full API Documentation.

Usage

WebTorrent is the first BitTorrent client that works in the browser, using open web standards (no plugins, just HTML5 and WebRTC)! It's easy to get started!

In the browser

Downloading a file is simple:
import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent'

const client = new WebTorrent()
const magnetURI = '...'

client.add(magnetURI, torrent => {
  // Got torrent metadata!
  console.log('Client is downloading:', torrent.infoHash)

  for (const file of torrent.files) {
    document.body.append(file.name)
  }
})
Seeding a file is simple, too:
import dragDrop from 'drag-drop'
import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent'

const client = new WebTorrent()

// When user drops files on the browser, create a new torrent and start seeding it!
dragDrop('body', files => {
  client.seed(files, torrent => {
    console.log('Client is seeding:', torrent.infoHash)
  })
})

There are more examples in docs/get-started.md.

Browserify

WebTorrent works great with browserify, an npm package that lets you use node-style require() to organize your browser code and load modules installed by npm (as seen in the previous examples).

Webpack

WebTorrent also works with webpack, another module bundler. However, webpack requires extra configuration which you can find in the webpack bundle config used by webtorrent.

Or, you can just use the pre-built version via import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent/dist/webtorrent.min.js' and skip the webpack configuration.

Script tag

WebTorrent is also available as a standalone script (webtorrent.min.js) which exposes WebTorrent on the window object, so it can be used with just a script tag:

<script type='module'>
  import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent.min.js'
</script>

The WebTorrent script is also hosted on fast, reliable CDN infrastructure (Cloudflare and MaxCDN) for easy inclusion on your site:

<script type='module'>
  import WebTorrent from 'https://esm.sh/webtorrent'
</script>
Chrome App

If you want to use WebTorrent in a Chrome App, you can include the following script:

<script type='module'>
  import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent.chromeapp.js'
</script>

Be sure to enable the chrome.sockets.udp and chrome.sockets.tcp permissions!

In Node.js

WebTorrent also works in node.js, using the same npm package! It's mad science!

NOTE: To connect to "web peers" (browsers) in addition to normal BitTorrent peers, use webtorrent-hybrid which includes WebRTC support for node.

As a command line app

WebTorrent is also available as a command line app. Here's how to use it:

$ npm install webtorrent-cli -g
$ webtorrent --help

To download a torrent:

To stream a torrent to a device like AirPlay or Chromecast, just pass a flag:

$ webtorrent magnet_uri --airplay

There are many supported streaming options:

--airplay               Apple TV
--chromecast            Chromecast
--mplayer               MPlayer
--mpv                   MPV
--omx [jack]            omx [default: hdmi]
--vlc                   VLC
--xbmc                  XBMC
--stdout                standard out [implies --quiet]

In addition to magnet uris, WebTorrent supports many ways to specify a torrent.

Talks about WebTorrent

  • Sep 2017 - Nordic JS - Get Rich Quick With P2P Crypto Currency
  • May 2017 - Char.la - WebTorrent and Peerify (Spanish)
  • Nov 2016 - NodeConf Argentina - Real world Electron: Building Cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript
  • May 2016 - SIGNAL Conference - BitTorrent in the Browser
  • May 2015 - Data Terra Nemo - WebTorrent: Mother of all demos
  • May 2015 - Data Terra Nemo - WebRTC Everywhere
  • Nov 2014 - JSConf Asia - How WebTorrent Works
  • Sep 2014 - NodeConf EU - WebRTC Mad Science (first working WebTorrent demo)
  • Apr 2014 - CraftConf - Bringing BitTorrent to the Web
  • May 2014 - JS.LA - How I Built a BitTorrent Client in the Browser (progress update; node client working)
  • Oct 2013 - RealtimeConf - WebRTC Black Magic (first mention of idea for WebTorrent)

Modules

Most of the active development is happening inside of small npm packages which are used by WebTorrent.

The Node Way™

"When applications are done well, they are just the really application-specific, brackish residue that can't be so easily abstracted away. All the nice, reusable components sublimate away onto github and npm where everybody can collaborate to advance the commons." — substack from "how I write modules"

Modules

These are the main modules that make up WebTorrent:

module tests version description
webtorrent torrent client (this module)
bittorrent-dht distributed hash table client
bittorrent-peerid identify client name/version
bittorrent-protocol bittorrent protocol stream
bittorrent-tracker bittorrent tracker server/client
bittorrent-lsd bittorrent local service discovery
create-torrent create .torrent files
magnet-uri parse magnet uris
parse-torrent parse torrent identifiers
render-media intelligently render media files
torrent-discovery find peers via dht, tracker, and lsd
ut_metadata metadata for magnet uris (protocol extension)
ut_pex peer discovery (protocol extension)

Enable debug logs

In node, enable debug logs by setting the DEBUG environment variable to the name of the module you want to debug (e.g. bittorrent-protocol, or * to print all logs).

In the browser, enable debug logs by running this in the developer console:

localStorage.setItem('debug', '*')

Disable by running this:

localStorage.removeItem('debug')

License

MIT. Copyright (c) Feross Aboukhadijeh and WebTorrent, LLC.

magnet uri support via ut_metadata
peer discovery via dht,
tracker,
lsd, and
ut_pex
protocol extension api
for adding new extensions


Comprehensive test suite (runs completely offline, so it's reliable and fast)
Check all the supported BEPs here

Browser/WebRTC environment features

WebRTC data channels for lightweight peer-to-peer communication with no plugins
No silos. WebTorrent is a P2P network for the entire web. WebTorrent clients
running on one domain can connect to clients on any other domain.
Stream video torrents into a <video> tag (webm, mkv, mp4, ogv, mov, etc (AV1, H264, HEVC*, VP8, VP9, AAC, FLAC, MP3, OPUS, Vorbis, etc))
Supports Chrome, Firefox, Opera and Safari.


  
    
  

Install
To install WebTorrent for use in node or the browser with import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent', run:

To install a webtorrent
command line program, run:
npm install webtorrent-cli -g
To install a WebTorrent desktop application for Mac, Windows, or Linux, see
WebTorrent Desktop.

Who is using WebTorrent today?
Lots of folks!
WebTorrent API Documentation
Read the full API Documentation.
Usage
WebTorrent is the first BitTorrent client that works in the browser, using open web
standards (no plugins, just HTML5 and WebRTC)! It's easy to get started!
In the browser
Downloading a file is simple:
import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent'

const client = new WebTorrent()
const magnetURI = '...'

client.add(magnetURI, torrent => {
  // Got torrent metadata!
  console.log('Client is downloading:', torrent.infoHash)

  for (const file of torrent.files) {
    document.body.append(file.name)
  }
})
Seeding a file is simple, too:
import dragDrop from 'drag-drop'
import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent'

const client = new WebTorrent()

// When user drops files on the browser, create a new torrent and start seeding it!
dragDrop('body', files => {
  client.seed(files, torrent => {
    console.log('Client is seeding:', torrent.infoHash)
  })
})
There are more examples in docs/get-started.md.
Browserify
WebTorrent works great with browserify, an npm package that lets
you use node-style require() to organize your browser code and load modules installed by npm (as seen in the previous examples).
Webpack
WebTorrent also works with webpack, another module
bundler. However, webpack requires extra configuration which you can find in the webpack bundle config used by webtorrent.
Or, you can just use the pre-built version via
import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent/dist/webtorrent.min.js' and skip the webpack configuration.
Script tag
WebTorrent is also available as a standalone script
(webtorrent.min.js) which exposes WebTorrent on the window
object, so it can be used with just a script tag:
<script type='module'>
  import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent.min.js'
</script>
The WebTorrent script is also hosted on fast, reliable CDN infrastructure (Cloudflare and
MaxCDN) for easy inclusion on your site:
<script type='module'>
  import WebTorrent from 'https://esm.sh/webtorrent'
</script>
Chrome App
If you want to use WebTorrent in a
Chrome App, you can include the
following script:
<script type='module'>
  import WebTorrent from 'webtorrent.chromeapp.js'
</script>
Be sure to enable the chrome.sockets.udp and chrome.sockets.tcp permissions!
In Node.js
WebTorrent also works in node.js, using the same npm package! It's mad science!
NOTE: To connect to "web peers" (browsers) in addition to normal BitTorrent peers, use
webtorrent-hybrid which includes WebRTC
support for node.
As a command line app
WebTorrent is also available as a
command line app. Here's how to use it:
$ npm install webtorrent-cli -g
$ webtorrent --help
To download a torrent:

To stream a torrent to a device like AirPlay or Chromecast, just pass a flag:
$ webtorrent magnet_uri --airplay
There are many supported streaming options:
--airplay               Apple TV
--chromecast            Chromecast
--mplayer               MPlayer
--mpv                   MPV
--omx [jack]            omx [default: hdmi]
--vlc                   VLC
--xbmc                  XBMC
--stdout                standard out [implies --quiet]
In addition to magnet uris, WebTorrent supports many ways to specify a torrent.

Modules
Most of the active development is happening inside of small npm packages which are used by WebTorrent.
The Node Way™

"When applications are done well, they are just the really application-specific, brackish residue that can't be so easily abstracted away. All the nice, reusable components sublimate away onto github and npm where everybody can collaborate to advance the commons." — substack from "how I write modules"


Modules
These are the main modules that make up WebTorrent:



module
tests
version
description




webtorrent


torrent client (this module)


bittorrent-dht


distributed hash table client


bittorrent-peerid


identify client name/version


bittorrent-protocol


bittorrent protocol stream


bittorrent-tracker


bittorrent tracker server/client


bittorrent-lsd


bittorrent local service discovery


create-torrent


create .torrent files


magnet-uri


parse magnet uris


parse-torrent


parse torrent identifiers


render-media


intelligently render media files


torrent-discovery


find peers via dht, tracker, and lsd


ut_metadata


metadata for magnet uris (protocol extension)


ut_pex


peer discovery (protocol extension)



Enable debug logs
In node, enable debug logs by setting the DEBUG environment variable to the name of the
module you want to debug (e.g. bittorrent-protocol, or * to print all logs).

In the browser, enable debug logs by running this in the developer console:
localStorage.setItem('debug', '*')
Disable by running this:
localStorage.removeItem('debug')
